Title: Erratum: Corrigendum to “Moisture dynamics in the masonry fabric of historic buildings subjected to wind-driven rain and flooding” (Building and Environment (2016) 104 (208–220) (S0360132316301676) (10.1016/j.buildenv.2016.05.015))
Abstract: © 2016 The Author(s)The authors would like to include some corrigenda: Caption of Figure 1 should read: Fig. 1. Aerial view showing the site, and the north-western elevations of Abbey Mill and 1-Mill Bank, respectively. (credits: Aktas, Y D et. al (2015) [6], Aerial photo from Google Earth © and the other two photos taken by A. Erkal) Caption of Figure 2 should read: Fig. 2. Schematic position of the sensors installed on the north-western façade of 1-Mill Bank and the south-western and north-western façades of Abbey Mill (WDR: Wind-Drive Rain Gauge, HRF: Horizontal Rain Fall Gauge, WS&WD: Wind Speed and Wind Direction Gauge, ST: Surface Temperature Sensor, WL: Water Level Sensor) (credits: Aktas, Y D et al. (2015) [6], photos taken by A. Erkal) Caption of Figure 3 should read: Fig. 3. WDR gauge designed and manufactured as part of project PARNASSUS on the facades of Abbey Mill and 1-Mill Bank, respectively (photos taken by A. Erkal and diagram adapted from Briggen, P M, Blocken, B, Schellen, H L (2009) Wind-driven rain on the façade of a monumental tower: Numerical simulation, full-scale validation and sensitivity analysis, Building and Environment 44, pp. 1675–1690) The Acknowledgement section should read: The authors are grateful to the Science and Heritage Programme supported by UK's Art and Humanities Research Council (AH/H032525) for funding this research. We acknowledge the substantial contribution of Dr. Aykut Erkal in the design and installation of the monitoring system. The support of Colin Franklin, and cooperation of 1-Mill Bank and Abbey Mill residents during the installation of the monitoring system are greatly appreciated. We would like to thank Manaswini Acharya, Phil Attwool and Majid Naderi from Surface Measurement Systems Ltd. (SMS) for their help with dynamic vapour sorption testing, and the Centre for Environmental Data Archives (CEDA) for providing wind data.
